column2: CA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Near streetcars, trolleys, or buses, the passing speed limit, when safe to pass, is:
column4: 10 MPH
column6: 20 MPH

column2: 2. Collisions tend to happen when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling much slower than the others.
column6: all vehicles are travelling near or at the same speed.
column8: one vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 3. What is the best advice for driving when heavy fog or dust occurs?
column4: Consider postponing your trip until the conditions improve.
column6: Slow down and come to a complete stop.
column8: Do not drive too slowly, because other drivers may hit you.

column2: 4. You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?
column4: Drive to the edge of the road and slow down.
column6: Driver to the right edge of the road and stop.
column8: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

column2: 5. If you cannot stop safely at a yellow traffic light, you should:
column4: stop your vehicle in the intersection, then back up carefully.
column6: stop your vehicle before entering the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection with caution and continue across.

column2: 6. You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:
column4: Under no circumstances
column6: If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
column8: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle

column2: 7. If another driver does not dim his or her lights, you should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights.
column6: watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye.
column8: look toward the left edge of your lane.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Pedestrian sidewalk ahead.
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
column8: Pedestrians must yield the right-of-way ahead.

column2: 9. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column6: finish crossing the street.

column2: 10. When you see this sign you:
column4: always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.
column6: are approaching a railroad crossing: prepare to stop.
column8: stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.
column6: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 12. The picture represents a _________ sign:
column4: Do Not Pass
column6: Do Not Enter

column2: 13. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 14. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: brake suddenly.

column2: 15. You should allow a four-second or more cushion when:
column4: Following motorcyclists on wet roads.
column6: Driving on slippery roads.

column2: 16. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.

column2: 17. Even if you know your vehicle can maneuver a sharp curve at the legal speed limit, you should still slow down because:
column4: there may be a stalled vehicle or collision ahead that you can’t see.
column6: the strong inward pull on your vehicle can be dangerous.
column8: you must legally drive below the speed limit on sharp curves.

column2: 18. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 19. You were parked and have been waiting a long time with your turn signal on to re-enter traffic. However, traffic is heavy. You should:
column4: drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.
column6: slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.
column8: continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

column2: 20. You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:
column4: yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column6: yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.
column8: vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.

column2: 21. Backing your vehicle is:
column4: dangerous if you have a helper.
column6: always dangerous to do.

column2: 22. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors are useless.
column6: Mirrors need to be adjusted.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 23. If the road is wet from a heavy rain, you should:
column4: drive one vehicle-length behind the vehicle ahead.
column6: increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead.
column8: use the “two second” following distance rule.

column2: 24. You are driving on a divided street with multiple lanes in your direction. If you need to make a U-turn, where should you start?
column4: On the shoulder.
column6: In the left lane.

column2: 25. If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: emergency flashers.
column6: parking lights.

column2: 26. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 27. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 28. Which of the following is NOT true about safety belts?
column4: They can trap you inside a vehicle.
column6: They can keep you from being thrown into the path of another vehicle.

column2: 29. When two vehicles meet on a steep road where neither vehicle can pass, which one must yield the right-of-way?
column4: The vehicle facing downhill
column6: The vehicle with the most passengers.

column2: 30. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 31. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 32. You are driving and there are oncoming vehicles on your left and a row of parked vehicles on your right. You should steer:
column4: a middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.
column6: closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles.
column8: closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles.

column2: 33. Which of the following is true about roadways on bridges and overpasses in cold, wet weather?
column4: They do not freeze because they are made of concrete.
column6: They tend to freeze before the rest of the road does.
column8: They tend to freeze after the rest of the road does.

column2: 34. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: one hour.
column6: 3 hours.

column2: 35. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column6: increases reaction time.

column2: 36. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
